page.title: 17ANIMALS IN LITTONDALE
page.content: Rabbits are the most numerous of the animals in the Dale, but one unusual feature is the number of pure black wild rabbits. A few hares can still be found. Moles are obviously numerous, though rarely seen, whilst foxes are still sometimes seen about in daytime. Many small animals, such as shrews, voles, dormice and fieldmice, exist in quite considerable numbers, as do rats. Hedgehogs and grey squirrels are fairly common. Although there used to be many deer in Littondale, now only an odd one is seen on very rare occaions. It is also a long time since badgers were seen in the Dale. The main predators, apart from foxes, are stoats, weasels, and recently a few mink have invaded the Dale.
